data.title: Glenn Greenwald is leaving The Guardian to launch his own news organization, which already has substantial monetary backing

In a single day, the N.S.A. collects an estimated 500,000 "buddy lists" from chat services as well as 444,743 email address books from Yahoo, 105k from Hotmail, 82k from Facebook, 33k from Gmail and 22k from unspecified other providers. Millions of Americans are impacted, yet no law authorizes it.
Greenwald on Snowden Leaks: The Worst Is Yet to Come

During a single day last year, the NSA collected 444,743 email address books from Yahoo, 105,068 from Hotmail, 82,857 from Facebook and 33,697 from Gmail. From US and Non-US citizens
